english: This (near me) is a pen (lit. speaking of this, it is a pen)
That (near you) is a pen (near you)
That (near you) is a ribbon / bow

japanese: <det>それ</><obj>は</><adj>かわいい</><noun>リボン</><verb>です</>
english: That (near you) is a cute ribbon
That (near you) is a big tree

notes: Adjectives\nTsumetai = cold (touch) not to be confused with samui = cold (weather)

japanese: <subject>ロシアの冬は</><adj>とても寒い</><verb>です</>
notes: Adjectives\nTsumetai = cold (touch) not to be confused with samui = cold (weather)
This/That + <noun> (この/その/あの)\nTsumetai = cold (touch) not to be confused with samui = cold (weather)

english: This movie is interesting / fun / entertaining

japanese: <det>この</><noun>ゲーム</><obj>は</><adj>つまんない</><verb>です</>
notes: This/That + <noun> (この/その/あの)\nつまらない is usually つまんない informally

english: That thing (you have) is a watch

japanese: <det>その</><noun>時計</><obj>は</><adj>かっこいい</><verb>です</><end>ね</>
notes: This/That + <noun> (この/その/あの)\nNe is used like "isnt it" you don't want to stand out and it softens it.
Ne is used like "isnt it" you don't want to stand out and it softens it.
Ne is used like "isnt it" you don't want to stand out and it softens it.

japanese: <adj>新しい</><noun>アニメ</><obj>は</><adj>面白い</><verb>です</>
<adj>新しい</><noun>アニメ</><obj>は</><adj>面白い</><verb>です</><end>ね</>
english: The new anime is interesting, isn't it?

japanese: <det>この</><adj>新しい</><noun>アニメ</><obj>は</><adj>面白い</><verb>です</>

notes: This/That + <noun> (この/その/あの)\nか at the end is used as a question marker in formal speech. Not in informal speech

japanese: <noun>ダニエルさん</><obj>の</><noun>ペン</><obj>は</><adj>高い</><verb>です</><end>か</>
<noun>ダニエルさん</><obj>の</><noun>車</><obj>は</><adj>かっこいい</><verb>です</><end>ね</>
english: Daniel, your car is cool, isn't it!

japanese: <det>あの</><noun>ピザ屋</><obj>の</><noun>ピザ</><obj>は</><adj>美味しい</><verb>です</>
english: The pizza at that pizza store is delicious (lit. Speaking of the pizza shop's pizza, it's delicious)
